ygData.messageBody:
On Fri, Sep 17/99, Bard <dabard@...> wrote:
> From: "Bard" <dabard@...>
>
> Last night I PvP'd a rogue friend of mine (he's 27 and I'm 24), he had 2
> proc'ing weapons, and I got him down into his las two bubbles of health.
> Not bad for being 3 levels under him and having no proc'ing weapons of my
> own. I think we are balanced just fine :o) (Although I still feel it goes
> against all of the bard lore that Verant has fed us for bards to NOT be able
> to bind themselves)
>

As the game is primarily PvE (environment) how could you possibly judge
your balance by testing a PvP encounter? And against a rogue? If any
class has a right to bitch about being nerfed it's rogues. That said,
try this little experiment. Get a high level warrior to _just_ taunt a
mob so it's back is to you while you attack it. Do the same with a
rogue. Time how fast it takes either of you to kill it.
